.\tools\idldoc
xidldoc.pro

Last modification date:
Mon Jan 17 13:59:02 2005

xIDLdoc is a graphical front-end for IDLdoc, the IDL documentation system developed by Mike Galloy of RSI.

To use xIDLdoc, IDLdoc should already be installed in a user's path or compiled in memory. IDLdoc messages, warnings and errors are displayed in the IDL output log.

Routine Summary  17 routines

Finds and returns the value of a widget (or, for a button widget, whether it is set), given the uname of the widget.

Routine Details

xidldoc::get_value

function xidldoc::get_value(uname)

Finds and returns the value of a widget (or, for a button widget, whether it is set), given the uname of the widget.

Returns
The value of the widget, or for a button, 1 if set, 0 if not set.

Parameters
uname
in, required
string 		The user value of the widget being manipulated.

xidldoc::set_value

procedure xidldoc::set_value, uname, value

Finds and sets the value of a widget, given the uname of the widget and the value to set.

Parameters
uname
in, required
string 		The user value of the widget being manipulated.
value
in, required
 		The value to assign the widget.

xidldoc::run

procedure xidldoc::run

Runs IDLdoc, given the parameters set in the xIDLdoc UI. IDLdoc messages, warnings and errors are displayed in the IDL output log. It is assumed that the user has IDLdoc installed, either in their path, or already compiled in memory.

xidldoc::handle_events

procedure xidldoc::handle_events, event

Handles events in the xIDLdoc UI. All events generated in the UI pass through the wrapper routine HANDLE_EVENTS and arrive here, where the event is parsed based on the generating widget's user name.

Parameters
event
in, required
structure 		The event structure passed from XMANAGER.

xidldoc::cleanup_widgets

procedure xidldoc::cleanup_widgets, top

Destroys the UI and cleans up any resources associated with it. Destroys the object in this case, as well.

This method is called by XMANAGER through the widget cleanup routine CLEANUP_WIDGETS.

Parameters
top
in
long 		The top-level base widget identifier, required in the call by XMANAGER.

xidldoc::start_xmanager

procedure xidldoc::start_xmanager

Calls XMANAGER to register xIDLdoc's widget interface. Events are passed through the wrapper routine HANDLE_EVENTS. The kill_notify signal is passed through CLEANUP_WIDGETS.

Note that the NO_BLOCK keyword is ignored by IDL Runtime/Virtual Machine for IDL < 6.0.

Uses
HANDLE_EVENTS, CLEANUP_WIDGETS

xidldoc::display

procedure xidldoc::display

Displays the header image in the draw window, if present.

procedure xidldoc::realize

Realizes the widget hierarchy.

xidldoc::center_ui

procedure xidldoc::center_ui

Centers the UI on the display.

xidldoc::make_input_row

procedure xidldoc::make_input_row, parent, label, text, [/no_button]

Makes a UI element consisting of a label, a text field and a "Browse" button.

Todo
Make this into a compound widget.

Parameters
parent
in, required
long 		The widget identifier of the parent base of this group of widgets.
label
in, required
string 		The text to display in the label widget.
text
in, required
string 		The text to display in the text widget.

Keywords
no_button
in, optional
boolean 		Set to not display the "Browse" button.

xidldoc::select_font

function xidldoc::select_font([/big], [/bold])

Returns a string containing the name of a font that can be used in a label or text widget.

Todo
Make this into an independent function outside this class definition.
Returns
A string giving the name of the font.

Keywords
big
in, optional
boolean 		Set this keyword to get a larger font.
bold
in, optional
boolean 		Set this keyword to get a bold font.

xidldoc::build_widgets

procedure xidldoc::build_widgets

Builds the widget hierarchy. Lots of buttons and fields.

xidldoc::destruct

procedure xidldoc::destruct

The actual class destructor. All cleanup code goes here, since it can be called directly.

xidldoc::cleanup

procedure xidldoc::cleanup

The official class destructor. This method can't be called directly, however, so all code is placed in the destruct method instead.

xidldoc::init

function xidldoc::init([header_image=RGB image])

Class constructor, used to load class data. Only one instance of xIDLdoc can run at any time.

Note that only a pixel-interleaved RGB image can be displayed at the top of the interface.

Returns
1 on success, 0 on failure.

Keywords
header_image
in, optional
RGB image 		A pixel-interleaved RGB image to be displayed at the top of the xIDLdoc interface.

xidldoc__define

procedure xidldoc__define

The xIDLdoc class data definition routine.

xidldoc

procedure xidldoc, [/no_image]

This is a wrapper for simplifying the creation and use of an xIDLdoc object.

Pre-condition
IDLdoc must be in the user's path or already compiled in the user's IDL session.
Examples 
   IDL> xidldoc
Requires
IDL 6.0
Uses
Michael D. Galloy's IDLdoc. IDLdoc can be downloaded for free from the RSI codebank: (www.rsinc.com/codebank).
Author
Mark Piper, RSI, 2004

Keywords
no_image
in, optional
boolean 		Set this keyword so that no image is displayed at the top of the xIDLdoc interface.

Personal IDL library of Michael Galloy, Professional Services Engineer - Trainer/Consultant, Research Systems
For more information about these routines contact Michael Galloy
Feel free to submit a bug or feature request for any of these routines
